revised_title: The Influence of Heredity and Extraneous Factors on the Proportion of Sexes in Humans
tldr: The author analyzes birth and stillbirth records from Cuba to investigate the factors influencing the proportion of male and female births. The study reveals a difference in sex ratios between white and colored populations and between legitimate and illegitimate births, suggesting that heredity and extraneous factors, such as metabolic activity and environmental conditions, play a role in determining sex ratios.
